Comments_List: I learned much about the media landscape and how it shapes democracy. The course readings were very interesting and informative on the successes and failures of modern media and how the changing media landscape has impacted our government and everyday lives. As far as writing, I feel I became a more clear and concise writer and learned how better to develop an argument.
My writing improved greatly in this course and taught me important analytical skills when reading through various texts.

I learned a lot in this in terms of both writing and the media as a whole. I think that my writing tremendously improved and I think that I will take these skills with me and develop them further. The class provided a great foundation for my writing skills.
I learned many new writing skills and a more in-depth understanding of media techniques.

I learned not only critical writing skills but also how to speak up in class. This class gave me many insights into journalism and what goes on behind the scenes, why journalism can be corrupt, and what we can do about it. Furthermore, this class also gave me courage to stand up in the world.

I learned to write clearly and concisely.

I also learned that the media has much more control over the political agenda than many people percieve.

I became better at not using passive voice in my writing and also mixing in more warrants in my writing. I also learned how media and democracy are connected and how the internet and the Digital age is changing media.

The biggest weakness of this course was that the readings and other assignments often distracted from the focus on writing. Too often we would discuss contemporary issues and all of the reasons why Republicans are bad instead of working on our writing assignments and receiving feedback. It would be helpful if the assignments were more closely mirrored to the readings or if the class time was more appropriately divided. 
This course was strong in teaching the intended content- writing and understanding democracy and the media.

There were strengths to this course. As stated earlier, a major strength was how I bettered my writing skills, as well as how I analyzed sources and readings. I also learned how to write more concisely. I do not think that I could think of any major weaknesses.
Strength is that it has a lot of potential. Weakness is that the writing style is specific to the teacher, so many meetings are required (not necessarily bad I liked talking to her)
